This app has low quality graphics, very noticeable on devices with 4K displays. The elements of the user interface are unreliable and require additional apps to enable controller or keyboard and mouse support. The matchmaking process takes too long and ignores player position input in competitive modes. Ranks are not taken into account in competitive mode matchmaking, at least up to the "platinum 1" rank. There are no consequences for "griefing" or leaving the game in ranked matches.

review: As a new player to the IP and a long time MOBA player, I find this game confusing. I don't know the characters, their abilities or the set up and I'm thrown into match after match on set roles. I have a countdown timer to fiquar this out while being matched with seasoned players and this is a tutorial? Having to win these matches for each class is just taking time away from actually learning the game by finding the mechanics that matches my play style. Without that, there's no fun in the game.

Riot consistently puts HORRIBLE teammates on your team, even if youre good at the game in PVP mode, otherwise the game is great. Teammates so bad that even the bots in the AI mode are ussually much more skilled at the game. IF riot can fix this I will gladly give the game a better reivew, but they probably won't considering the same complaint about PC league has been an issue for a long time as well.

This game is amazing especially when you compare it to the other games on the market. All the bad reviews I see and just pc players complaining about how it‚Äôs not the same. It‚Äôs not lol on mobile it‚Äôs mobile lol. Ofc you can‚Äôt react as fast and ofc the controls won‚Äôt be as smooth but you‚Äôre not on a pc you‚Äôre on your phone what did you expect, them to copy and paste the game and everything work the same ü§™.One reason is they aren‚Äôt constantly trying to get you to spend money after every game you play. Another is no character is so extremely op that they can literally kill you by themselves with two auto attacks like in mobile legends or arena of valor. It‚Äôs very balanced. Because it‚Äôs so balanced teamfights actually matter and they aren‚Äôt just a spam of abilities and whoever has the most dps wins. I don‚Äôt wanna make this review too long bcuz then no one will read it but the only problem I have with this game at the moment is that sometimes you‚Äôll get out in a game and everyone will pick their characters and then the game will say failed to connect and when you try and rejoin it says the game already ended. The games isn‚Äôt in your match history either which shows that it‚Äôs not just your WiFi cutting out.

This game is made beautifully! There for sure is a lot more to come since the PC version has been out since the stone ages and there‚Äôs, I‚Äôd say, less than half the champions available now on the mobile version.
There‚Äôs always an event happening and getting materials to buy new champions is fairly quick. I‚Äôd say too quick to be honest, considering most events you get the new champion for free if you participate.
Mechanically not the greatest but compared to other MOBAS for mobile, it‚Äôs one of the best. 
One thing I don‚Äôt enjoy about Wild Rift is matchmaking. I‚Äôm no pro and far from one, but it‚Äôs hard to rank up and when analyzing how much damage I am doing and even absorbing compared to my teammates, just about every other match I do and take nearly the most besides a tank and maybe a support if we had a hybrid. Sometimes even more damage than the entire enemy team which is hard to ignore. It would be nice if ‚Äúskill level‚Äù was not based on more than it is now which seems like it‚Äôs just your current rank. One other improvement I want to speak on is being able to see skin effects before buying them. If I am going to purchase a skin for my earned money, I want to know what it comes with such as sound and visual effects that change with the champions skill like the ‚ÄúArcade‚Äù series. Anyways, still excited I don‚Äôt need to be on PC to play one of my all time favorite games!
review_title: Best MOBA for Mobile hands down

review: So much better than Arena of Valor. Wasn‚Äôt expecting decent gameplay on mobile platforms but on the iPad Pro, this game is phenomenally good. Buttery smooth frame rate at 120fps, not a hitch in graphics at all on a 3rd gen iPad Pro, if you have something newer then you‚Äôll be good for a while as well. Like that I can log in with existing account for Riot. You can buy buttons to stick on the screen if you don‚Äôt like the thumb movement control. I tend to slide around further than the designated circle for movement. Everything else is fine though. The game is easier to play on a touch screen than I would have imagined. I would like to see controller support added though. Arena of Valor was put on Nintendo switch and it works fantastic there. Better yet, put Wild Rift on Nintendo switch as well please, and don‚Äôt separate it from the mobile player base like AoV did (that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs dying on switch). Since apple has allowed controllers via Bluetooth, it should be considered for moba titles on iOS/iPad OS. The only other gripe I have is that nothing transfers over in terms of purchased characters from the PC version. You do seem to get a new hero every time you level up though which is nice. The premium pass is cheap at only ten bucks for extra funsies. Bring controller support and allow things to transfer over like purchased hero‚Äôs and skins and this game will be by far the best moba on mobile platforms.

Never married before, but I haven‚Äôt touched grass in eleven months since I started playing, so I probably will never have the chance again. I played Wild Rift first on my iPad, after seeing many friends constantly on League proper. I played for a number of months, learning all the champions and grinding ranked. Eventually, I felt like I‚Äôd reached my limit, and because of how good this (mobile) game is, I purchased a PC to play the full thing! But to my surprise, Wild Rift still stands in its own right and is as good as the game in many places, sometimes MUCH BETTER than the original. Weaker points are mostly related to superficial factors, the frequent empty headed plays from people playing at work/in class/etc, feeders or inting players, toxic individuals in chat, leavers, and so on. Where the game soars is in its excellent pacing of each match, the punishing but also extremely enjoyable ranked systems(and now legendary update!), and the graphics that are somehow better than the main game. I mean, seriously, the fact that the client interface looks better than the PC game puts those developers to shame. All this to say, Wild Rift team has created something that will be around and exponentially permeating through mobile society for many years to come. I‚Äôm excited to see where they take both the casual and competitive scene from here. INSTALL THE GAME AND ENTER THE RIFT!!!
review_title: This Game Lost Me My Wife and Kids

review: Great game! It‚Äôs league but at the convenience of being accessible at your fingertips. Yeah, there are short comings especially compared to it‚Äôs counter part being played on pcs, macs, and other computers. You can‚Äôt expect the full experience while being on a phone, but, you still get reactive, real time combat and controls, tons of different characters with their own unique abilities and own influence on the overall strategic play through of 5 versus 5. Game mechanics make it extremely insensitive to players who lose connection or have their own phone die during game, resulting in a disciplinary ‚Äútime-out,‚Äù requiring players to wait until their able to play a match (without any possibility for you to defend the reason behind why the ‚ÄúAFK‚Äù happened). Also depending on server maintenance and your own internet ping, you may experience a terrible game simply because you cannot react in time due to time lapse in between members of the match. Lastly, many people say it‚Äôs a harsh game on people who pay to play compared to the free to play players. It‚Äôs absolutely wrong! LOL has ALWAYS been a free to play game. If you want to look cool and buy a skin then go ahead, but it‚Äôs the people who know the mechanics, implement strategy and never even have to pay a dime of RWC that actually dominate this amazing game!

First let me just say, for those players who are saying just play pc league need to stop because there is a good market for mobile play and honestly some people don‚Äôt have the time investment to play an hour long game and some people don‚Äôt have PC set ups to run smooth games. Do not be discouraged by the reviews and try it out! It‚Äôs got amazing graphics, very smooth gameplay that has a greater emphasis on teamwork, a nice clean interface that isn‚Äôt too overwhelming and other little baubles you can play around with to customize your gameplay and controls to fit your needs. There is definitely room to improve but it is still in beta so it‚Äôs not even the full game yet.

As someone who plays mobile games and specifically mobile MOBA‚Äôs, I can honestly say that Wild Rift is something that blows most other mobas out of the water. Obviously with league to base off of it‚Äôs bound to be good but what sets it apart from games like Mobile Legends or Arena of Valor is the fact that it feels strongly team based rather than a heavy reliance on over powered champions to make a random team comp in order to overwhelm a more balanced team. There are certainly overpowered champions that can carry in WR too but at the very least you can come back with some patience.

The game overall is fine. However when the LoL community has been asking for major improvements for months they never deliver. The worst thing that can happen is a ‚Äúchat ban‚Äù. However these same kids are still ruining games and refuse to surrender causing suffering for 4 other players. Riot you need to step up your game and start giving out harsher punishments. Instead of an‚Äùtemporary chat restriction‚Äù how about a Ranked restriction? Where the player cannot que ranked for 2-8 weeks. This game used to be fun and competitive however it‚Äôs over run with the same toxic PC community. It‚Äôs a little insane. I tell myself ok I‚Äôll try again tomorrow and the next day the first 5 games include all toxic children or leavers. Makes the game not even playable. I hope this reaches out to a game dev or someone. You guys need to fix match making to have limits too. Being Diamond should not allow gold/plats just because the ‚Äúsystem thinks their doing well‚Äù. It should absolutely not allow people two entire tiers below you. Literally ruins the game. It should be iron/silver gold/plat Em/Diamond, not allow a gold 4 in an emerald 1 game. Anyway. You guys need to stop dropping the ban hammer and get control of this toxic player base in NA. Speaking of which, I live in the United States. I am never paired on teams with people who speak English. Latins need their own server. I haven‚Äôt seen another player who speaks English in months. It‚Äôs really annoying.

review:
It‚Äôs fun for an occasional game on the go, but it‚Äôs nothing compared to the original PC version. The controls are a bit clunky although I don‚Äôt really play mobile games. The auto targeting is a little buggy as some long range abilities such as Lux‚Äôs ult will sometimes lock on to a jungle camp instead of the enemy champion, and for melee champs it is difficult to target an enemy champion if they are standing too close to minions with only your finger and not the precision of an actual mouse. There‚Äôs no draft picking at this time so champ select can be rough, especially when you get queued with newer players who may not understand roles. I‚Äôve ended up in a few matches with only supports on my team, which wasn‚Äôt a fun time. 

Some additions to the game such as mirror lanes are completely unnecessary and make things more complicated than they need to be, especially for newer players. I opened a ticket with Riot to see if there was an option somewhere to disable the mirror lanes, and the person who wrote me back said that there wasn‚Äôt but agreed that it caused things to be messy! Hopefully if their own team thinks this they will add an option to disable it soon. Also with as much time and effort as I‚Äôve put into the pc version as far as unlocking champions and skins, I wish at least some of that could carry over, rather than treating this as an entirely different game.
review_title: It‚Äôs ok but much prefer the original version of League

review:
The game on mobile is pretty fun. I like the idea and concept and have a good understanding of how LoL works. I dislike the matchmaking and how it is not skill based (especially your teammates) and hate that I‚Äôm having to carry every game in order to get to higher ranks. That‚Äôs not a big issue though because that‚Äôs to be expected in almost every game.
My main issue lies with the fact that on random days for random amounts of time, I won‚Äôt be able to play games on my main account. I‚Äôll log in thinking I‚Äôll be able to play a game while I‚Äôm on the go and then find that I don‚Äôt see my friends that are online, my profile picture, my rank, and the wild pass. All of these things are just missing and at first I thought it was a wifi issue but when I made a second account that issue wasn‚Äôt happening on that account. This bug is super annoying to deal with especially because I did grind events to get skins on it and would like to use them. This bug also makes it so that every 10-15 seconds you get a loading ‚ÄúL‚Äù (the League of Legends symbol). This bug fix would make the game much more enjoyable and fun.
Overall it‚Äôs a good game the concept and idea is super cool. Would also love to see more game modes that we see on PC like URF, ARAM, etc.
Sadly, until this bug is fixed I will not be playing this game and will have it uninstalled. 
So, FIX THAT ASAP PLEASE.
review_title: Loved the game on PC but there‚Äôs too many bugs on mobile...

review: Probably the best MOBA I‚Äôve ever played.  I‚Äôve tried other MOBA on iOS and they can‚Äôt compare to this game.  This game combat is so much nicer and polished than others.  You don‚Äôt have to worry about auto targeting at minions when being ganked or in 1v1.  Other MOBAs had those issues even after I messed around with the settings.  Everything seems really balanced and I haven‚Äôt experienced games where someone would 2 shot me mid-game.  Champions and skins are actually obtainable by just playing the game unlike most other MOBAs I‚Äôve played MOBAs where you would have to grind forever or wait till events pops up just to have half of the price of the champion you want.  HUD is really good and doesn‚Äôt cover your whole screen and the lighting is nice and smooth.  Although Wild Rift‚Äôs champions have been fleshed out more than their competitors, the champions designs and abilities are really nice and doesn‚Äôt seem too uninspired like other MOBAs I‚Äôve played.  This game is a little more competitive than other MOBAs I‚Äôve played but who doesn‚Äôt like a little challenge.   Would definitely recommend this game to anyone who‚Äôs into MOBAs because of the more polished gameplay and the minimal grinding for skins and champions compared to other MOBAs.

This game, first of all, lemme start out by saying this. I‚Äôve NEVER in my 6 years of owning an iPhone, EVER submitted a review on ANY game. But this MOBA? League Of Legends: Wild Rift? This game truly is something else. I find myself playing this game for what feels like only minutes at a time, only to realize that 4 hours of passed, and I remember I need to take a break every now and again to give my eyes time to relax themselves. This is the ONLY mobile game I have ever spent THIS much time on, and never ONCE got bored, tired, mad or agitated at. I never played the League Of Legends game on PC. But why would I?! I have the best version of it right here in my pocket!! Riot Games, y‚Äôall keep doing what you‚Äôre doing! This is a MOBA unlike ANY OTHER. It‚Äôs fun, action-packed, visually pleasing, the champions are impeccably made from designs to in-game abilities/movement/lines. 
~
To anybody who wants to play this game but MIGHT be skeptical about it? I feel you. I was the EXACT same way when I heard of this game! I heard so many mixed reviews and opinions about the PC version, only to be simply FLABBERGASTED by the mobile version! Download this game. Please. I beg of you. If you‚Äôre a due-hard MOBA fan like myself? You won‚Äôt regret this decision. :)

I‚Äôve been playing league since 2011 and have a pretty good understanding of the simple to intermediate aspects of the game. One aspect of wild rift that is almost non-existent is the support role. There is no ‚Äúsupport item‚Äù tabs, but there are some support items but you have to dig to find them. Though there is an easy way to target enemies, there is not a option or function to interact with allies quickly. This makes targeting teammates almost impossible during a team fight and renders the support useless.
One key feature of this game that is incredibly frustrating is the character control speed vs. skill shot speed. I would HIGHLY recommend a tweaking of this system. In pc version of league, reacting and dodging skill shots is almost instantaneous because of clicking. However, the transition to mobile kept skill shots at the same travel speed, but users now have to drag their thumb across a screen to dodge skill shots which delays the reaction time. I have never had this much of an issue dodging skill shots on the pc and the above reason is my opinion as to why it is soooo much harder to pull off. 
I will be deleting this app until these (mainly the support issues) are addressed. I also have an issue with not having access to skins I paid for in the pc version of the game. If money was exchanged then I believe I should have access to that item in all versions of this game.
review_title: It‚Äôs ok, but missing key components

review: This is my first dive into the world of Runeterra.  To begin to explaining my phone heating up seems cheap but ultimately not on the hands of the writer who penned a story, or the animator who crisped a design for the smallest screens.  But never the less no one is without flaws.  Despite this I play this game at least once a day.   The variety of four moves and 83 characters is already complex.  Six classes.  Five lanes.  Unreleased heroes.  Dragons.  Hextech.  Stories, Relationships, Alliances, Enemies, Love, Revenge, Genius Intellects, Spirited Wit, Selfless Duty!  These and many aspects of this game, the lore and the characters are unforgettable.  This is an adventure I plan to share for my whole life.  Like eating or driving these characters and gameplay is a welcome escape in these trying times of delusion and purposeful disinformation.  I will be changing my phone because it cannot be calm while I play a game that frankly, is too big for its humble confinements.  I would like an option to give the opposite team thumbs up or praise.  This game is in my eyes as perfect as any of us.  Good intentioned and delivering in troves with subtle hiccups and lapses in judgement or balancing like the varied characters in all of us.  I will return to aid the Rift and see what happens of this Enormous, Adventurous, Wild World.
review_title: An Adventure to the Rift and Back.

review:
The first few levels you feel like your moving threw a good card game/story‚Ä¶ then the wall‚Ä¶ I have played multiple characters up to level 6 trying to beat the first couple of enemies in the Gangplank level 2, but to no avail. So I stuck with Vi and leveled her up (by grinding, aka multiple defeats and deaths for chump change reward) and am now on my third attempt with 1 revive that came as part of her most recent level‚Ä¶ something like 13 or 14. 
     I really enjoy the game but I think having such a hard map after just cruising the begging was rather thoughtless and cruel.  My joy of the game has vanished and it‚Äôs become more of a task and choir. I probably won‚Äôt continue if I can‚Äôt defeat the Gang plank map by level 15.
     The game is fantastic so I give it five stars, but the legion marauders infinite multiplier take 1 star away. Since there isn‚Äôt anyway to heal between the marauders and Swain, another star is destroyed (see how the game plays?). For the constant hammering of Swain taking 1 from nexus without offering a way to balance the fight(usually starting with 15 or less on nexus) another star is destroyed. For the lopsided randomness that favors the Ai another star. Again after such a battle what wins against Swain without proper availabilities and wasted Errol‚Äôs presenting the same items‚Ä¶ oh no, that was the last star‚Ä¶

This really is the best MOBA game for mobile. I can‚Äôt stop playing it. 

With the roles I understand the importance of everyone being active in the match and the desire to punish those who go AFK or abandon the team. Yes that can be annoying. But banning someone from playing for an hour is a bit much. And if it happens too often in a week then it doubles, and the next thing you know it‚Äôs 6 hours, maybe longer before you can play again. Sometimes life doesn‚Äôt let you play uninterrupted. Maybe you‚Äôre in the middle of a game and you have to make a choice between life, family, friends, and a GAME. The sane person would choose the former, but then you can‚Äôt have the downtime you need later because you‚Äôve been temporarily blocked from playing. Oh and if you had to leave but then didn‚Äôt immediately get back in to manually accept to the restriction, then when you finally are able to login it sometimes starts the counter at that moment instead of when you quit which makes it even longer. It gets ridiculous. I‚Äôve never seen a game that punishes you so much for trying to balance life and the need for distraction that made you download the game in the first place. Mobile games need more leniency.

As a league pc player of 5 or so years now I‚Äôve really enjoyed this game. But there‚Äôs this one issue with the matchmaking system that gets me tilted every game it happens in. If ur in a mid-high elo rank game, u would expect others on ur team to be and play at the same level as that rank or better right? Well the matchmakin system puts total scrubs and trolls who play LOWER than that elo(whatever elo that may be, platinum or grandmaster or whatever) and that one player just drags the whole rest of the team down with how they play. It also makes us lose games and LP when we ourselves r actually trying to advance into the next rank. I‚Äôve been in mid platinum to lower emerald for the past few months now and bc of said people in my team I always get demoted except for the  seemingly rare games where I get people who play at their elo level or higher. Ik the system needs to get everyone into games. I understand that. I just hope that in the future the matchmakin system will put ppl into the elo that they play like or at least make it more fair for the people who r actually trying to advance ranks and the people who can‚Äôt play at the elo level they‚Äôre in.
review_title: Great game and fun to play but‚Ä¶

review: I am COMPLETELY new to anything to do with LOL. My boyfriend plays it on PC and I got into the game as a way for us to have fun and bond. All of this to say that I am extremely new to champions and specific details such as runes and items in shop. Within a month I got Gold 2 and Mastery 6. I chalked it up to being a fast learner but now that I play LOL pc I realized that wild rift is just extremely broken. PVP games REALLY need a draft option. It‚Äôs beyond annoying when you‚Äôve already called dibs on a lane but another player is butthurt and still chooses a champion that was made just for your lane *cough* jinx. Even when the 2 of us play together, the rest of the team is trash, AFK, or feeding the other team. I am the most mediocre player on WR yet it seems like I carry most games .. and still lose. Forget about ranking up.. they will purposely level you up all the way down to the promo game.. and then give you absolute trolls that will make you start all over. Some champions are extremely broken, I can‚Äôt count on one hand how many times I get one tapped on champions that in LOL I actually have a fair fight with. Oh, and you gotta love the massive updates every once in a while. Eats up my storage and I don‚Äôt even have that many apps in my phone. 2 stars because this game made a LOL fan and the boyfriend is very happy. Otherwise, zero.

review: The only MOBA other than Smite that I adore playing. High-quality game, for sure. üëçüèª You can tell a lot of time and energy has been given to this game. I heard of League of Legends for the computer and was always interested in trying it but hadn‚Äôt played it (no technical skill on a mouse and keyboard.) üò© They made a mobile version and I‚Äôm glad they did because I really am awful with a mouse and keyboard. Game is updated regularly with cosmetics and measures are taken to keep things as appropriate as possible. Of course there will be unpleasant people in the chat but you can just turn the chat off like I did, if you‚Äôd like. Also thankfully the characters voice lines during game matches can be silenced. Cause some of them can be annoying. üòå I‚Äôm no fan of violence so I‚Äôm kind of surprised I‚Äôm so into this game. Thankfully there is no gore, blood or anything that might make sensitive folks like me uncomfortable. I just really like this game. üòÅ The graphics are pretty and there are a lot of different characters I‚Äôm drawn to. Lots of ways to personalize your favorite characters, profile, and in-game cosmetics. Ummm.. yeah give it a try I guess üòÑ

I‚Äôm no MOBA junkie, nor am I a LoL PC veteran drifting on over to Wild Rift for a breath of fresh air. I am however an avid mobile gamer and a lover of quality and playability. Wild Rift offers lovely visuals, an awesome array of champions, and a litany of nice resources to take advantage of for the purposes of ‚Äúlearning the ropes.‚Äù I‚Äôm determined to keep a relatively casual mindset when playing this game, while at the same time trying to become a skilled and proficient player that adds value to my team. With this casual (but focused) disposition towards the game, I don‚Äôt plan on viciously clawing my way up the ranks, nor do I plan on griefing people who don‚Äôt stay in their lane (literally). It‚Äôs just a game and I don‚Äôt want to take it too seriously; in my opinion games lose their enjoyment too quickly when they‚Äôre taken too seriously. All that to say, if you‚Äôre like me and like quality & playability then you‚Äôll probably enjoy this game and more than likely won‚Äôt experience the toxicity that the leaderboard junkies will either (a) run into themselves, or (b) promulgate. Enjoy the game, have fun, don‚Äôt take it too seriously. Temper your expectations.

This game is a fairly faithful adaptation of the original pc version, it‚Äôs stripped down for the mobile platform but overall plays pretty similar. My problem is not with the game itself but the player base (obviously not everyone). League is already an extremely toxic game, couple that with the mobile multiplayer base and you have a recipe for disaster. The toxicity seems lower at first because of the hassle of chat on a mobile device, however the problems occur more in game than in chat. I frequently get players in ranked mode who obviously have never played the game or at least haven‚Äôt for very long, locking into a role they don‚Äôt know how to play with a champion they‚Äôve also never played before. Very little effort is put into the overall team in this team based game, although this seemed to get better in higher elos. If you‚Äôre not willing to grind out a ton of games to get out of bronze and silver, you‚Äôll probably have a bad time with this game. I‚Äôd recommend to anyone who plays league regularly and just want something to play be it on a long car ride or to kill 15 minutes while waiting for something, other than that, unless you‚Äôre actually willing to learn the game, please stay out of my ranked lobbies

Wild Rift is absolutely amazing. Great graphics, not p2w, competitive gameplay, good controls, an active development team who actually care about the game and tons of additional content. However, the match making system is horrifically bad. There is never really any chance for comeback once you get behind. I have been playing for a few months now and I‚Äôve accomplished maybe 2 comeback wins. There are too many factors that can make you lose the game. One of your laners falls way behind and feeds the enemy. Someone goes AFK. Your jungle doesn‚Äôt gank. It feels like you‚Äôll know if you win or lose at the beginning of the game and there is no way to change that. I‚Äôve started playing PVP over Ranked because it destroys my mental trying to rank up and losing no matter what I do. I‚Äôve had 25+ kill games and lost because my team couldn‚Äôt pull their weight. Match making needs a huge overhaul imo. However it is a fantastic game, i wish you didnt have to purchase champions but i dont think that'll ever change. The best MOBA on mobile by far. Hopefully this helps anyone who is considering downloading this game :)

This game is as fun as LoL but hilariously horrible at math. From 100 health - 800dmg = 1200 health to 40% health - 10% health= dead. And my favorite is a cold hard 60 damage is 63% of 2,600. It‚Äôs insane haha. Health bars are just ornaments that don‚Äôt correlate to gameplay at this point. There‚Äôs also a lot of hit box issues and attacks hitting far outside their visuals. Not to mention auto attack for a lot of abilities is random at best even when you‚Äôre locked on and standing still there‚Äôs still a 1/6 chance you‚Äôll fire in a random direction. The game runs smooth at 60 fps with 19ms so you‚Äôd never expect it to be lag or anything. I guess they figured it‚Äôs an arcade game so who cares about the math. Until you get to a point in rank when it matters to you. Also wouldn‚Äôt hurt to reconfigure who gets the kill. You never notice it unless you play aram. If you do, play as pyke and sit in spawn to get good kills xD 

Community is as toxic as any competitive PC game too. They got rid of all chat so now it‚Äôs just people constantly throwing games by talking trash to teammates. You‚Äôd think they realize it doesn‚Äôt help anyone. Everyone is an expert who has never had a bad game but is gold 2. Go figure. I hope they crack down on bans for those people and lane stealing in ranked. I‚Äôve lost interest officially at this point. Maybe I‚Äôll try to get back into it in a few months

Hello. I gave 1 star for very bad experence on this game. I'm playing from 0 season, and i can say this game is not very bad, whole looking is realy nice. I know this game is pretty fresh but guys... Listen. I left this game a lot of times and came back on every big update and its... NOTHING. You focusing and working on wrong things. Match making system is the biggest broken thing in this game and second one is AFK and TROLLS. Whats happening? Its realy that hard to put some main things from pc version to receive a better quality of gaming? Where is a dodge system from matchmaking? Where is an early surrender if some1 goes afk and points doesnt lost? Another one FAIL. You said working on mmr and fixed it. What did you fixed? I got 4 ranked matches in a row with unranked, bronze, silver teammates, while i m in emerald. Whats this? Who will give me back my lost points of your system fail? Its impossible to play solo que and a lot people will agree with this. At first Focus on the gameplay, not on your wildpasses or other things. I played few times MOBA LEGENDS and i can say guys uhhh, you need a loooot of work to reach that game level...  I thought you will be more ready for mobile version, but for now its just more stressful game than fun. Because 8 loss streak and all of afks and mmr system fail its not fun.

Good luck for the future
review_title: Very bad, better keep focus on PC version

review: I‚Äôve played this game since day one. I have tried and tried to be loyal to this game, even purchasing the pass every month. I play ranked every single day, and through all of the trolls and afk people that I had to go through I finally made it to Diamond. I rarely ever have deaths over four and statistically are shown that I‚Äôm better than most in my rank. It was difficult enough having to grind all the way from ground up and to Diamond with all of the disgusting behavior. With the recent update, all players that were in lower Diamond (which wasn‚Äôt my fault.. I was at Diamond 2 before I got hit hard with trolls), we were all demoted to Platinum. Now I have to pair up with way lower skilled players AND trolls. Trying to get over ranking issues and reports never mattering, I recently purchased the Redeeming Star Guardian Pass. The developers are SO greedy that they limited the Star Guardian skins that come in one of the mission boxes. I‚Äôve been wanting Star Guardian Seraphine but now won‚Äôt be able to get her due to the paywall. It‚Äôs always about money. I buy the battle pass every month. Now you want me to spend money on event passes? Fix your game first before taking our money. Why do you penalize your players for trolls‚Äô behavior? I tried to believe that you guys were going to fix the game but it‚Äôs clear that you‚Äôre not.

I‚Äôll start out saying that I started playing LoL years ago on pc and have a pretty decent understanding of the game and that a lot of people playing this are probably fairly new to the game. That being said the only problem I have with this game is that it doesn‚Äôt clarify a whole lot on lanes and what champions are what so when you start a game with what looks like a good team build you‚Äôll have a support going mid when someone else already chose a mid champ or the duo lane players going to solo lane or jungle not jungling and making the solo lane a duo lane. It gets a little frustrating losing games because people simply haven‚Äôt been given enough info to know these basic things. Done with the negative on to the positive. This game is amazingly built. No it is not the same as pc but in some ways it‚Äôs even more enjoyable. It‚Äôs great that right from the start you‚Äôre able to build your champion pool so much early on rather than having to grind or pay money. The controls are great and it‚Äôs just as strategic as the LoL. Overall I highly recommend this game, just hope developers plan on making certain aspects easier to understand for new players like they have in LoL.
review_title: Amazing game that needs a little bit of work

review:
I got really into this game, like REALLY into it, and I was meeting and playing with a lot of really fun people. After several months of good times Riot implemented a patch that took away 'All-Chat.' 
     Why? My interpretation of the patch notes was that some players couldn't control their emotions and would start fights with their own teammates and/or the enemy team. That being said; there is a convenient 'mute-button' next to each individual player that can be toggled at any time during the game. On top of that you also have the ability to toggle 'All-Chat' in the settings. 
      Anytime I play this game now it honestly feels so  empty and disconnected. I almost never see anyone using the chat system anymore; just from taking away the ability to communicate with the enemy team. 
     Now I realize the game is not designed to also be a social platform, it's designed to be a competitive game, but couldn't there be a compromise? Couldn't we keep 'All-Chat' in normal games and take it out for ranked? 
   Anyway, Riot tried to remove all-chat on their desktop version of the game but the community strongly rejected that idea. Wild Rift unfortunately doesn't yet have a strong enough community to fight back the removal so Riot got away with it.

This isn‚Äôt a perfect port.  Abilities have been changed, items and build paths have been altered and simplified, the controls are somewhat limited and occasionally the predictive ‚Äúaim assist‚Äù does truly insane things.  With that said, it‚Äôs still the best port I‚Äôve seen next to Call of Duty.  The feel of the pc game is here in the same way.  I‚Äôve dumped hundreds of hours into this mobile game‚Ä¶ maybe thousands, and it‚Äôs a joy.  I have only spent money on a few cosmetic options.  There is absolutely no pay to win component.  You‚Äôre given enough of the f2p currency you acquire from just playing to get a bunch of free champions at the start and give yourself more than enough options to do well.  Much of the time, new champs are simply given to you if you do basic challenge missions during the launch week.  And the balance in this game, while not perfect, is not set up so that new champs are S tier to the point where it‚Äôs literally impossible to win against them.  You can still win and crush on release champs at any ranked level.
review_title: The only MOBA worth touching on mobile

review: YOUR PRACTICE MODE CHEATS?!  I mean, I knew you guys made REALLY bad marketing decia, because you WILL NOT do anything about the toxic in-game chat, the lopsided matching system, OR... The ever-increasing pricing changes, which make out to about half of the value that you get in return for our investments, in your game (you know, that helps pay your salaries), as we used to but the CONSISTENT CHEATING AND BULLYING of YOUR bot AI for PRACTICE MODE... Makes it impossible for me to want to buy new champions (and skins, and all the other junk you over-charge for)... Especially if I am not allowed to practice it because your PRACTICE MODE will either allow YOUR BOTS to ban EVEN brand new champions that we JUST spent money on.  Or, if you just reset it until it finally let's you play what you pick, ALL OF THE ENTIRE ENEMY TEAM will gang up on THE ONLY LIVE REAL PLAYER IN THE GAME.  And, NO,... There is NOTHING you can do because MY bot team will, not only walk over to an enemy that is taking a tower... And then... Walk right away and let it get taken, BUT... They also WILL NOT respond to pings,.. And will abandon you in a team fight... When you were only there to HELP THEM!  You must be TRYING to run off your customers good jobs and disposable income!  Brilliant.  I'm taking a long break.  Maybe I will return one day. Probably not though.

I personally enjoy this game a lot. It‚Äôs not to difficult to pick up. Not much else to say besides it being fun. The issue comes when people go afk, making the rest of the round highly unbalanced. Not only that, but I wish there was a little more balancing. If one teams gets a lead, most likely they will win. Which I suppose it apart of the game, but it gets unfair and boring when one team is absolutely destroying. That is worse when we have afk people. Still a fun game. Idk why people are complaining. It does it‚Äôs job being a fun game for mobile.

EDIT. I haven‚Äôt noticed many of the issues presented in many reviews. So I will have to get a taste of them before I say something about that.
Second is, while in a game, you can‚Äôt leave or go without being punished, which is good, but if while being punished for being afk one could still play vs ai, it would be nice because for the next hour or so i have to go play or do something else. Life happens sometimes, and being punished to not be able to play the game at all when you return is unfortunate.
review_title: Not a bad game, but does have its flaws‚Ä¶

review:
My god it‚Äôs insane, I went on a 8 game winning streak which helped me get all the way to emerald 3, now I‚Äôm losing insanely badly. Literally game starts, enemy team instantly gets a first blood then it‚Äôs downhill from that point on. I‚Äôm playing fine in my lane but yet my top is already 1/5 within 5 minutes of the game, and my mid is 1/4. Why is the game putting me with these people who literally have no idea what they are doing? This is ridiculous, I can admit when I played horribly and I was the leading factor to me losing the game, but these last 3 games I just had were just people trolling, arguing in chat, and literally being completely useless. This matchmaking system for the higher ranks is completely and I mean COMPLETELY GARBAGE. Riot finds pure enjoyment in putting you in these high rank games where you will lose because you have trolls on your games, intentional feeders, and literal infants on your team. It pushes me me so badly from this game, I just don‚Äôt understand why riot doesn‚Äôt care‚Ä¶ losers queue is real‚Ä¶
How do you allow these players to get into these ranks? How? HOW? They are a plague to ranked. I thought maybe once I get to a higher rank that you know I‚Äôd be with people who are are actually serious about playing the game, BUT NAH ITS STILL JUST AS BAD IF NOT EVEN WORSE!
review_title: Unbearable matchmaking for plat and above

review:
Pretty much every mobile moba currently on the market is a blatant copy of currently existing pc mobas. This however is an exception. They managed to bring a pc moba to mobile. 

Somehow it runs very well. If you were wanting to learn how to play league but don‚Äôt have the time for it, this my friend, is the perfect app for you. Rather than spending 30 minutes with one champion just trying to figure out what to do, this game provides you a stress free environment that any beginner would enjoy. It can really be a gateway for beginners to get into the moba genre. I have spent 1,000 hours of my life playing league, so if your looking for a game you can make friends with and spend lots of time on having the time of your life, I wholeheartedly recommend this game.

This may just be me trying to compensate for the years I‚Äôve lost to this game, but I don‚Äôt regret it. I‚Äôve had a blast and I‚Äôm sure you will too. If your feeling confident playing this game I recommend you get started on the pc version, it‚Äôs completely free and anyone can download it on any pc.

It‚Äôs obvious how much effort the developer team placed into it. You see extremely smooth actions, well made models, and an eye pleasing map. In the last few patches, the developer team placed more effort than before; we see the introduction of much more items and their attempts to rebalance the game are much more logical as well. Compared to League PC, Wild Rift is much more preferable. There‚Äôs definitely more content and it‚Äôs more competitive on PC but everything on PC just looks horrible. From the walk animation to the champion models themselves; even the map looks like it‚Äôs from 2010. 

There are a few cons that I would like to point out which mainly centers around the player base themselves. Simply put, the lower you are, the more trolls and toxic people you get as teammates and that can be very annoying. Even though I am in Grandmasters, this happens often as well. That being said, unless somebody went afk and disconnect for an extended period of time, anything you report on the reporting system will not go through. They simply don‚Äôt care.

I‚Äôm currently in high elo and are loving the simplicity of things but there are a few issues . The balance of some champs far out ways others . Due to computer issues I can‚Äôt play normal league because it constantly freezes in loading screen. This is the only way I can play it but there are several things from pc I want added . For starters how about having a patch come out once a month for the game during the second patch of a normal month of league. There needs to be more champions like some of my favorites I can‚Äôt even play because they aren‚Äôt one here . For example volibear , ekko, Warwick , and I would love to be able to play some other characters like zac , vex or Gwen.  I understand putting the new characters in are quite a undertaking for some of the recent added mechanics. Taking into account it is supposed to appeal to more people I understand it . Also having lore events as well would be super cool like the ruination event from last year but in a smaller scale . Nevertheless I still enjoy the game and hope to see more stuff added in the future.

Between the breaking of the auto targeting system, to the absolutely broken matchmaking and the complete lack of punishment for players who bm and afk, this game is a complete mess.  You‚Äôre not allowed to win too many games because then you‚Äôre forced to carry people with much lower win rates even if you‚Äôre not the type to carry games.  The auto targeting will often prioritize a minion or jungle farm or something so far out of your range you can‚Äôt even see it on your screen making you waste a skill and lose a kill or worse yet result in your own death in a team fight. Sometimes you get matched with players that are beyond out of your elo (Gold 4 getting matched with Emeralds, Silvers, and Unrankeds in the same game.  And that‚Äôs all before getting to stuff like balancing or technical stuff like unresponsive touch controls.  This game is genuinely headache inducing after a certain point of playing because there are coin flip odds of winning a game, even if you consistently play competently.  Also lost a game once after a team surrendered because the game progresses after a surrender is acknowledged and a minion killed nexus before their nexus loss animation started playing, which is a huge oversight.  This game is rough and needs a lot of work.
review_title: The more you play, the worse it gets

review: I‚Äôve been playing League of Legends for years. This game is entirely a mobile version of the computer game w/ a lot of ease of use plugged into it. Overall, it‚Äôs a good representation of the game and a lot of fun to play. NOW, the reason I say ‚Äúmoney grab‚Äù is nothing transfers... which is really sad to be honest. When riot came out with their other game it was linked to your original account which told me it wasn‚Äôt created just to get your money. This one however does not do this which means you have to start completely over and you have to buy everything all over again. That‚Äôs just wrong. Now I feel like Riot is just in it for the money and not for the players anymore. What a waste of a game that many would play on the go. With this tho I have a hard time wanting to play it because why would I want to spend money on something twice? (For example, you can buy alternate costumes for each character and you have to use real money for those. Why pay for it in the computer version and then again on the mobile version)
review_title: Decent game, but a money grab.

review: This game is really fun, a great way to pass time and get your adrenaline pumping(for me atleast), especially the wide variety of characters and their skins. Some are more annoying to fight against than others(which is part of the game ofcourse), and sometimes I do envy the(expensive) skins that people have LOL, maybe someday you guys could make them cheaper for a limited time(I'm unsure if you guys do that for Black Friday or have done anything like that before). I can only really play Wild Rift and not the pc version. I've seen alot of the skins from pc that aren't on Wild Rift which kinda bummed me out. I'm a huge Jinx fan and I'm working on collecting all her skins. Theres some really awesome ones on pc that I hope/wish to see available on Wild Rift(and other skins alongside).  I don't know if the developers look at the reviews but I do hope this will be seen by them. I know Chroma Jinx isn't available alongside FireCracker Jinx, and I wasn't around to play when they were. I do hope, though, to see them available again.

I used to be an avid Vainglory player, along with Dota back in the day. Since Vainglory‚Äôs server went down due to Covid, Wild Rift has filled that void and then some. I highly recommend this game. It has everything you need in a MOBA. I hate the joystick feature and really wish you guys would add tap controls to it, but this is just me nitpicking. Thanks for this gem, I will be playing it for a long time! Keep the updates and great working coming!
The only thing, which I came back and had to add this‚Ä¶why am I getting penalized in ranked matches if a teammate goes afk? I‚Äôm Platinum IV ranked, and it seems the higher I go, the more trolls I find.  You guys should definitely protect the players that are dedicated to finishing matches, wether winning or losing. If someone goes afk or leaves, they should be penalized. The opposing team should get credit for the win, but why does the losing team, with the afk player get penalized? Please fix this, make penalties more extreme for players that abandon games, and protect those that do not.
review_title: This is a gem for mobile MOBA fans...

review:
Played LoL on and off on PC for about 10 years. Haven‚Äôt played the PC version in over a year because I just don‚Äôt have the time to invest. With a busy life, kids, etc. I just can‚Äôt set aside 1 hour to play a single match. I love wild rift because it‚Äôs everything I used to love about LoL but much quicker! A long game is 25 minutes, I can set that amount of time aside with no issue! It‚Äôs honestly the best mobile game I‚Äôve ever played. I‚Äôve never been into games on my phone, just didn‚Äôt play any of them, but I‚Äôve found myself playing Wild Rift on my phone at night as opposed to a PC or console game, it‚Äôs just that much fun. Can‚Äôt wait to see how it evokes with more balances and character patches.

Also, it‚Äôs surprisingly generous with characters and skins to unlock. I have plenty of characters and enough points to unlock a couple more that I haven‚Äôt used. Skins do not transfer from PC but that‚Äôs fine, this game is still worth it, especially if you love LoL but can‚Äôt manage the 45min to 1hr matches with a busy life.

I play or should I say played PC LoL and while this is a dumb down version of LoL I am shocked how much more I enjoy this compared to PC. PC version has reach a point where I get constantly harass for having fun, picking my favorite champion , or just trying a new champion. While it isn‚Äôt the core issue with PC version it really affects my motivation to play. Here that isn‚Äôt an issue so I get to go into a game and have fun, Even in rank. I‚Äôm very bad with keyboard so it‚Äôs nice to have controls that feel more for me even if I hate touch controls. My biggest issue with this game is some of the auto targeting and how a lot of my skins don‚Äôt transition to mobile which is a bummer because I enjoy this version a million times more and I have supported and bought lots and lots of skins in PC. I realized it‚Äôs trying to start from scratch but for long time supporters of LoL feels kind like slap in the face specially when I want to transition to mobile and will not be playing PC anymore.
review_title: Surprisingly fun as someone who hates touch controls

review: Dear Riot Games, Your game is good. I like wild rift. It has all of them components that made LoL good, ported to mobile. You did miss some characters, but that's ok. First, let's talk gameplay. Overall, the gameplay itself is slightly above mediocre. Becoming MVP or SVP mean absolutely nothing when considering your next game. You can have 50 kills in one game, but then your next game could be bots. The general structure of characters is relatively balanced, even though a metagame forms in a way that overpowers character choice. Second, let's talk player base. This player base is mustard gas. Almost everyone is either a sore winner or a sore loser. Toxic Teemos run the land of trying to get you to quit the game by making you feel worse about yourself in chat. This makes it a 4 star for me. Third, let's talk updates/services. RIOT! Your gonna bleed people off your game because you aren't taking their suggestions! Your gonna end up like Bloons TD Battles 2! Fix bugs! People are constantly giving you good suggestions that would make the game better. At least take it into consideration! The fact that you don't makes it a 3 star for LoL:Wild Rift

Wildrift is amazing mobile moba game. I‚Äôve been playing league for many years and when I play wildrift it has a very similar feeling. The champ models in the game looks very nice and the events give out so many free things. But there are a few minor flaws(in my opinion of course). Some of the champs very underwhelming comparing to their pc counter parts. For exp when you play Camille her true damage from her q is not nearly as much compared to pc and her e range is so much smaller. There‚Äôs many other champs that are like this. I understand they need to change certain champs to fit the game, but when playing the champ it just feels different and unfun. Another complaint that I have is the items are different compared to the pc. All the mythic items have not been added to the game yet and I personally really like all the new items from s11 league. Lastly this is just a personal thing but I wish they kept the prices for champs the same, like there should be cheaper champs and more expensive ones so it‚Äôll feel more like league.

The reason league is a good game is because the characters that take skill take time and effort to learn. They have taken not only time, not only effort, but skill away from the equation. I have literally watched Yasuo 5v1 pentakill 6 times after playing the game for almost 30 hours. In the 1,000 hours that I have played league I have seen a Yasuo 1v5 ONCE. There‚Äôs literally no point to playing tanks, adcs reign completely supreme in every aspect because it takes nothing to kite. This app is a garbage patch work of league in every sense. The servers crash my game every 3-4 matches and then don‚Äôt let me reconnect and then BAN ME FOR BEING DISCONNECTED. It‚Äôs absolutely garbage. And if you‚Äôre serious about league in any way this game with NEVER, EVER, EVER! Cease to consistently make you want to slam your head through a wall, and upset you to no foreseeable end. In no way should you support this complete and absolute garbage in any way. If this game is taking development time away from league then not only is this app bad but it is a cancer on the community as a whole. DO NOT. I REPEAT. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME IF YOU ARE A FAN OF LEAGUE OF LEGENDS. UNBALANCED IN EVERY SENSE OF THE WORD WITH POOR SERVERS AND CRAPPY MOBILE GAME PROGRESSION.
review_title: Poor implementation, lack of any real balance, and servers that will make you throw your phone.

review: Game froze in loading screen and by the time I realized it was frozen and reloaded the game I received ‚Äúafk‚Äù penalty and was punished by have delayed matchmaking where they make you waste 150seconds in que before each game for 3 games. The issue was completely on the app, not on me or my device, but I was punished for it. Account gets chat restricted for 160 hours every time I use chat when I only chat for strategic purposes and only in ranked. Calling a toxic inter trash shouldn‚Äôt get you chat restricted for 160 hours, this game is a joke. I was going to hit challenger by having good macro and calls in team chat but as soon as I‚Äôm banned and can‚Äôt call out important info in chat my win streak stops and games become harder. Meanwhile enemies can freely chat and strategize (assuming they aren‚Äôt victims of the sensitive auto bans). This causes ranked to have no real balance when one team has an ability that yours is banned from having. Similar issue with getting matched with multiple languages on one team. AT LEAST ADD MORE QUICK CHAT OPTIONS AND REMOVE THE 4 LIMIT ON EMOTES AND QUICK CHAT FOR THE LOVE OF GOD. IT TAKES 4 PINGS MINIMUM TO GET TEAMS ATTENTION. AND DONT EVEN GET ME STARTED ON HOW THEY BAN YOU FROM PINGING IF YOU PING TOO MUCH. MY BAD FOR GIVING TEAM VALUABLE INFO.
review_title: Broken game punishes you for no reason

review: This game has amazing graphics, high-intensity mechanics and interesting characters and was once a favorite of mine when Season 2 came out. However, it has become an absolute mess of a game after the past few seasons. New champions with ridiculous abilities continue to appear without any proper balancing and older champions have received no meaningful buffs whatsoever. And to top all of it off, the matchmaking system in this game is by far the worst I have ever experienced in this genre of the game. You can be repeatedly matched with people who troll or afk every game while the other team seems perfectly fine. The penalty system in this game is completely useless and enforces nothing against repeat offenders and frankly you will find yourself doubting whether you have actually improved at all because of how many times you can lose in a single session. Finally, the customer support provided by Riot is quite mediocre. At times they answer questions with proper explanations and make an effort to create improvements in the game but at other times, they simply ignore you and say random things that neither help nor make sense. Overall, started out great but is continuing to go downhill with each season.

It took a while to get to the NA region being that League of Legends was originally an NA made game. Yet, overall it is a fun addition to the many games Riot has created. I have followed their progress since 2012 and I have to say they don‚Äôt ever miss a beat when it comes to making amazing development, mechanics and providing their audience with adventure no matter where they are. From the Blitzcrank grab game back in 2015 to the several top notch games on mobile today, Wild Rift has got to be the best. Not only did they learn from mobile MOBA predecessors like Vainglory, they also added their own flair from League of Legends PC. Ensuring the additions of favorite champs with more of the cast to come and an easy to use interface, I‚Äôm sure those that give below a 4 star are just the ported over toxic community that had too high of expectations and that their favorite champion (base Urgot) hasn‚Äôt been put in. Thank for all the hard work, and always keeping to a freemium policy - Sincerely, YaporaYariziac
review_title: League of Legends on the Go!

review: First time doing a review, I have been playing league of legend for many many many years now (11 years almost) and because I moved in the USA without my computer I have been craving for league of legend. After waiting for about 2 years without playing league of legend, I am now so happy to finally play my only favorite game of all time. And this version of league of legend is perfect. Even for an early stage of the game I am stunned. A super smooth 60 FPS, beautiful graphics (just like pc version), super easy controls and very responsive, it even have few more amazing features that even the pc version doesn‚Äôt have. I will put money in this mobile game for the first time ever (I never thought I would put money on any mobile game ever but here I am now! ) thank you so much riot game, you are making me the happiest man on earth when i am so far from my home country and my friends (and my league of legend but now I have wild rift so it doesn‚Äôt matter anymore lol) . Keep the good work !!

When it comes to mobile games this has so many great things going for it. It feels and plays a lot like the pc LoL. When I‚Äôm on the go it‚Äôs a great for a quick game here or there. However, ranked is just plan horrendous. The matchmaking is terrible. When I have repeated games of teammates who go 0/12, 0/9 etc or who are afk and get ‚Äúa penalty‚Äù it just ruins the experience. There has to be a better way to filter out players who are not attempting to play as a team or just plan don‚Äôt play in a match. Force afkers and throwers to match up with other griefers. It can‚Äôt be that difficult. Nothing can be a buzz kill like a thrower‚Ä¶that is unless you get multiple games in a row with them. Fix it.

Edit: 
I decided to give wild rift a second shot after watching arcane. Been playing for about a month.  This season of ranked was going well until I switched roles and started winning a ton.  Improved my rank from gold 1 to plat 2 very quickly.  It seems like the game noticed my above average play and has penalized me by giving me bad teammates or trolls for 12 games in a row.  Literally 2-12 and my winning % now dropped to 50%.  It‚Äôs so frustrating.  I want to enjoy the game but one feeder just ruins everything.
review_title: I want to like this game so badly
developerResponse: {'id': 23975668, 'body': "Hi Freaver1,\n\nThat sounds like something we might be able to help you with! Send us a ticket at https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we'll try to get you back on track.", 'modified': '2021-07-17T02:54:16Z'}

review: I have been playing lol since it first ever produce a hen I was back in high school. When I saw wild rift it was amazing that I can carry and play anywhere just on my phone. I love the addition of both old and new characters. I do agree with the comment replied to you especially with the ranked mode. I am having difficulties ranking up because of afk and intentional feeding. Ever since I started playing ranked, it‚Äôs been one loss and one Win. It gets frustrating because you aren‚Äôt going anywhere. I believe that developers should add more shield or give more shield to players when ranking down. It is annoying that you are playing so hard and you get crapped over by one person on the team. I understand that that everyone is here to play for fun but many players do not show good sportsmanship and I hope lol can find ways to rectify this problem. There are players who are frustrated and most times just quit  mid-game. Wild Rift in general is a great game to learn and have fun.

This game is a very good game. It has similar mechanics to pc version, but has a different balancing system so it is refreshing. The heroes for LoL are much better than other mobas, but i have only one major complaint about this game. The abandonment system is terrible. I abandon three matches in a week, and i have a two hour ban i have to log in to activate. Lets say i have to do something so I am forced to abandon my match. Three hours later, i log back in to a screen that says ive been banned for 20 minutes. Ok. I do it again, only for an hour to be added every time i abandon in 7 DAYS! It is applied to every gamemode, even AI matches. I dont play ARAM, so I dont know if this is the case there. I am now sitting here with nothing to do because i had to go three times in one week. It is stupid, please make a new system. Otherwise, the gameplay is excellent along with the brilliant event systems and how it is the perfect amount of grinding for each hero. But please, this is ruining my experience. Thank you.

The game is awesome and so much fun to play. I think Riot really put the time and love in on this one. I‚Äôm happy they took their time and made sure they had something special before they released it. I see some people complaining about the controls however I haven‚Äôt run into any issues and think they work great and suit a mobile game great. In a lot of ways I prefer this game to the PC version of league, I think the matches are more intense and move quicker. The smaller number of champions is refreshing and makes for more balanced and approachable gameplay in my opinion. 

The only thing I would recommend at this time is controller support. I think the touch controls are great but adding a controller would really be appreciated by those who use them for other ios games, and especially those playing on an ipad. Since Wild Rift was supposed to be the same game on mobile and consoles controller support would definitely be conducive to this.

Again awesome game and thanks so much for the hard work!

5 stars because it looks and feels better than any other mobile game out there but it has its issues. #1 - no afk protection. Its essential to making the game feel fair. 10-30% of my games on a daily basis are lost to afk or trolling teammates that don‚Äôt get punished properly. Meanwhile the chat ban starts at 68 hours. That‚Äôs how long an afk ban should be if there‚Äôs no afk protection. Way too long for a chat restriction, flame is mean/annoying while going afk/inting ruins the enjoyment of the game for everyone. So PUNISH the players actually ruining the game please. #2 - Lee sin. #3 - wild pass stops.  There should be unlimited rewards even if it‚Äôs just blue essence IMO  #4 - lp gain/loss should just be even no? It‚Äôs kinda infuriating to win 1 lose 1 and actually be lower lp that you started especially when that loss is to an intinf player that can just queue up again

Otherwise great job great game keep it up a lot of these reviews do not have any validity to them so I wanted to leave my own üëæ

I picked this up after playing on PC for years. One thing I love about this game is how fast the games are. I‚Äôm the kind of guy that likes to play every single champ. In pc league of legends it seems to take hours and hours to really lock in how a champ works. Say for instance you accidentally throw your first game with a new champ. Instead of waiting 30 to 40 mins to try again wild rift makes it 10-15. I‚Äôve found myself learning champs in wild rift Rand taking that knowledge into league of legends. It‚Äôs almost like a training ground for your micro play. Also if you get into the competitive aspect of the game your macro will be tested as well. You have to make your decisions way faster and the effect of your decisions is made clear much sooner in wild rift than it is in your regular game of league. I highly recommend playing wild rift if you‚Äôre new or just need some decent practice. Any PC gamer that plays this and doesn‚Äôt find the value in it is missing out.

Honestly.  Been here since day one.  Games in a horrible state 
 The ranked systems LOADED TO THE BRIM. With boosters win traders hackers dcers hard feeders account swappers or the ladder.  
Lemme explain.  The game used to be better cause you had bronze and silver feeders and boosters in the bottom of the barrel ( where they belong ).  Now as a plat / emerald.  I play ranked and get people dragging bronze and silver low Ello feeders who think they are better then BRONZE. The game used to be fair balanced and aside from feeders the worst is the cheating.  Mostly damage amps defense amps ward hacks/ sight hacks and BOT FARMERS. If you don‚Äôt get those ( 7/10 games this year.) you have duos bringing first timers in ranked cause it‚Äôs not protected with a limit or min requirement. So you‚Äôll be emerald - diamond matched against a full emerald team and some douche brings there bronze lvl 10-20 buddy.  The matchups are normally 15-30* ranked division difference and you get the shafted end 9/10.  The game needs to bang harder also and look into better anti cheats.  I shouldn‚Äôt see bots almost every night. I rarely play 6-10 games a night or even a week if I‚Äôm lucky . That‚Äôs TO MUCH. For a game like leagues.  Do better disgraceful
review_title: God awful for ranked.  Sligtly better for normals.

review:
Now, I'll start off by saying that the PC and Mobile version [cannot] be compared.  Why?  Because they are two completely different platforms with communities that look for different aspects and are accustomed to different types of controls.

Wild Rift is basically a bite-sized version of PC League that includes the major parts of the game (minions, turret AI, economy, and roles).  It's more suitable for players that want to play this game to kill a little bit of time and not have to play a whole full-fledged battle.  The devs did a good job at simplifying stuff by desaturating the amount of detail on item effects.  If makes it easier for players to learn the game and to make it feel less overwhelming.

The only thing I love about this game is its faithfulness to the original and its platform-appropriate adaptation.

The only thing I don't like is how the support role has a lack of presence.  In the time I have played this game, I have not sensed a support player ever.  They felt like dead weight that just followed the team, which didn't seem like it helped or punished anyone at all.  If the PvP mechanics of Wild Rift were at least a bit more similar to League PC (in terms of healing and slowing), maybe it would help the Support role feel more valuable.  Otherwise, we could run two ADCs and disregard Supp.

The reason why I am giving this five stars is because of how the controls and the goal of the game were adapted well.
review_title: For those coming drom LoL PC

review:
Don‚Äôt get me wrong I love the game. However I don‚Äôt love the people playing. I match up with players that are obviously feeding and trash talking the team and no matter what I do or say they don‚Äôt get any repercussions. 

Recently I just played a game where one of my teammates banned my pre picked champ and was completely throwing and feeding throughout the match. They never helped their duo and they ran away from team fights plus they did not help when asked. Because of this one person it ended up causing me and 3 other people to lose a match which is so unfair. They were blatantly griefing and no matter how much I report them NOTHING HAPPENS. What? They get warnings? Can‚Äôt play a couple games? That‚Äôs not a worthy penalty. They literally ruined the game and made it less fun. It‚Äôs frustrating how these players get away with it so often to the point where I give up reporting all together. I just wish they could receive harsher penalties and that you take the reporting system more seriously.

Overall the game is satisfying to play. The controls are straightforward, itemization is easy, and the game is condensed enough to be fit for mobile without it feeling watered down. Matchmaking, however, needs fixing and can make not only ranked but normal games unfair and unpleasant. Grandmasters can play in lobbies with silver players in norms and ARAM- that should never happen, even late at night. Every time this happens, the game‚Äôs outcome depends entirely on whether the master+ player wants to try. As for ranked, climbing on low ranked accounts can be so difficult it‚Äôs not fun anymore. I am low platinum matched with emerald/diamond players every match, which makes me not want to keep playing to reach the rank the game thinks I should be in. To climb I either need to consistently beat players better than me or throw matches until I‚Äôm back with people in my rank. Let me play with people near my skill level in unranked matches and don‚Äôt put me in ranked lobbies where I‚Äôm 2 ranks below everybody else.

Great game, just like league other then not enough runes, champions, and items. Also the ranked system needs to be fixed. I don‚Äôt know if MMR is a thing in wild rift like it is in league but I hit Diamond 4 yesterday and am somehow paired with low platinums on my team. As anyone could guess they are the reason I dropped out of Diamond because every loss is -15 lp and every win is 10. I strive to be the best and low elo players only hold me back when I would rather be playing with players better then me to become better. I also dislike how people can abuse the 5 player system in ranked when it‚Äôs called ‚ÄúSolo/Duo.‚Äù Some players can get free wins by doing the bare minimum because their friends can just carry them. Ranked is suppose to make you in particular a better player. I soloed 85% of my games to Diamond and find it frustrating always playing against 5 mans who just abuse the ranked system.  It should be updated so the Men can separate themselves from the boys who just want to have fun.

I have not had this much fun with a mobile game in a long time. When I was younger my grandma was in the hospital all the time and as a result I would be left in the waiting room or at home playing classic games like Clash of Clan or Doodle Jump on my iPod. It‚Äôs been a long time since I‚Äôve had the honor to play a game that engages me with other people online in a competitive and action packed atmosphere. I‚Äôve always been a bit of a nerd who struggled with sports so it‚Äôs lovely to find sanctuary within this game. A game that I can take literally anywhere with me and kill time with. If I had to pick one word to describe this game and the amazing experience I‚Äôve had with it, I would have to go with the phrase ‚Äútears of joy‚Äù, it would be hard to describe this game in any other way. The amount of fun and achievement I have received from this game is beyond me. This game also has been such a blessing as it has distracted me from my addiction to nicotine. I‚Äôve been 2 days sober, thank you Riot Games!

Gameplay is nice but it still needs work as it looks and plays more like a beta version of the game 1 during hero select u should have a map that shows which lane each person is recommended to go into with each hero INCLUDING TEAMMATES character 
S 2make hero selection easier to see what type of hero each hero actually is not put hero‚Äôs in that can do said lane not they probably could do it but not as effectively as hero‚Äôs that where meant to go in those slots ie a tank that‚Äôs meant for a support roll should not be under a recommendation for juggling noobs will select anything but what they should if it‚Äôs under a recommendation 3 if your going to select rolls for each person that say what roll the game selected for them during hero selection and lock them into it unless they want to switch don‚Äôt make teammates suffer because someone else wants to be a juggler and not a mage and make the team lose because he doesn‚Äôt want to be a mage.

review: I tried to enjoy the game but it‚Äôs not balanced I win one game and lose 4 games after I carry the team I get set up with people who didn‚Äôt help than after that win one game lose other even my friends said there is not much difference in rank and regular play feels the same where we come from work want to try knew champions and than get destroyed like if it‚Äôs rank plus people keep saying troll when we try to learn the championship in game not practice I say iv trued this for one month I cannot recommend this version of the game to any one stick to pc version League of legends it‚Äôs a bit better it‚Äôs just how they set match making it‚Äôs off feels way to hard I don‚Äôt want to be stressed out after work in a mobile game as much I think they failed in making it an app version of mobile game simple because not only not balanced you can‚Äôt really try out new champions because some are op and some aren‚Äôt it‚Äôs to bad there is no saving this game just like Van Glory I recommend Mobile legend bang bang they are a bit pay to win but it‚Äôs much easier to rank up plus much more balanced.
